about.title: Relatronica
about.tagline: We imagine possible futures and create tools that help communities understand, discuss and shape them, empowering civic participation on fundamental issues for our collective future.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: Relatronica is a design studio born in Switzerland in 2024 from a team of designers and researchers who met at CERN, the European Organization for Nuclear Research. It combines {speculativeDesign}, {civicTech} and {knowledgeMapping} to explore future scenarios and create tools that help communities understand, discuss and navigate the complexities of the contemporary world, fostering informed participation in decisions affecting humanity.
mission.speculativeDesignTooltip: A creative approach that imagines possible future scenarios to stimulate critical reflections on how today's technologies and choices might shape tomorrow.
mission.civicTechTooltip: Digital technologies created to improve community life, facilitate civic participation and make public information more accessible to everyone.
mission.knowledgeMappingTooltip: The visualization of connections between ideas, concepts and data to make knowledge more understandable and help identify relationships that would otherwise remain hidden.

origins.title: Our Origins at CERN
origins.paragraph1: Relatronica was born in Switzerland in 2024 from the meeting, at CERN, between designers and researchers who share the same question: how can we use technologies and data to truly engage people in choices concerning humanity's future?
origins.paragraph2: CERN is one of the symbols of international scientific collaboration. It was here, in 1991, that the World Wide Web was born, conceived as an open space to share knowledge and make information accessible to everyone. Since then, the Web has revolutionized our lives, but many crucial decisions – on climate, energy, research, infrastructure – are still perceived as distant, technical, poorly participated.
origins.paragraph3: With Relatronica we want to carry forward and expand that original spirit: not just a Web where you read and inform yourself, but spaces and tools where people can understand, discuss and contribute. We transform complex topics into clear paths of participation, to bring citizens, institutions and scientific communities closer together.

speculativeDesign.title: Speculative Design
speculativeDesign.description: We design alternative future scenarios to stimulate critical thinking and open conversations about possible futures. Through prototypes and narratives, we explore the ethical, social and technological implications of possible developments.

civicTech.title: Civic Tech
civicTech.description: We develop digital technologies that empower communities and improve access to public information. We create tools that facilitate civic participation and democratic transparency.

knowledgeMapping.title: Knowledge Mapping
knowledgeMapping.description: We visualize relationships between concepts, data and ideas to make knowledge more accessible and understandable. Our mapping tools help navigate complexity and identify hidden connections.

approach.title: Our Approach
approach.intro: We combine research, design and technology to create projects that:

points.critical: Stimulate critical thinking about possible futures
points.ethics: Explore the ethical implications of emerging technologies

activism.title: Activism for Responsible Technologies
activism.intro: We firmly believe that technology must be designed and developed responsibly, ethically and oriented towards collective well-being. Our commitment goes beyond design: we are active in promoting a more aware and critical technological culture.

ethics.title: Ethics and Humanity
ethics.description: We promote technologies that put people at the center, respect human rights and foster inclusion and social equity.

transparency.title: Transparency and Control
transparency.description: We support transparent, open source and decentralized systems that restore control and autonomy to communities and individuals.

education.title: Critical Education
education.description: We create tools and resources that help understand the implications of emerging technologies and develop informed critical thinking.

sustainability.title: Digital Sustainability
sustainability.description: We design solutions that consider environmental impact, energy efficiency and the longevity of digital systems.

values.title: Our Values
values.intro: The principles that guide our work and our design choices:

accessibility.title: Accessibility
accessibility.description: We believe that information and tools must be accessible to everyone, regardless of technical background or available resources.

participation.title: Participation
participation.description: We promote collaborative and inclusive processes that involve communities in defining their own future.

critical.title: Critical Thinking
critical.description: We stimulate deep reflections and uncomfortable questions, avoiding simplistic solutions to complex problems.

responsibility.title: Responsibility
responsibility.description: We take responsibility for the ethical, social and environmental implications of our creations.

openness.title: Openness
openness.description: We favor open source, transparent and reproducible approaches that promote knowledge sharing.

nexthuman.title: NextHuman
nexthuman.paragraph1: This project represents an example of our work: a calendar of probabilistic deadlines for humanity. Through interactive visualizations and speculative scenarios, we explore the challenges and opportunities awaiting our collective future, combining knowledge mapping to show relationships between events and civic tech to make this information accessible to everyone.
nexthuman.paragraph2: NextHuman is also a manifesto of our approach: we use technology to stimulate awareness, foster public debate and encourage concrete actions towards more desirable futures. Every visualization, every scenario, every mapped connection is an invitation to reflect, discuss and act responsibly.

collaborate.title: Want to Collaborate?
collaborate.description: We are always interested in collaborations, projects and conversations about speculative design, civic tech, knowledge mapping and responsible technologies. If you share our values and want to explore possible futures together, don't hesitate to contact us.

support.title: Support the Open Future
support.description: Relatronica is an independent, open-source project. We don't sell data, show ads, or seek investors who might steer our choices. Our work exists because people believe that tools for understanding the future should remain free, accessible, and belong to everyone.
support.impact: Supporting Relatronica isn't a donation -- it's an act of civic participation. Every contribution allows us to keep developing open tools, independent research, and educational resources for communities.

segno.title: SEGNO
segno.subtitle: Digital sovereignty
segno.description: A platform to take back control of your digital life. It offers learning paths on privacy, digital rights and GDPR, practical tools for data protection, a map of your digital footprint, and an ethical stack to evaluate the sovereignty of the services we use every day.

rebica.title: Rebica
rebica.subtitle: SDL Citizen Lab
rebica.description: Turns future scenarios into executable code. Instead of static slides, every hypothesis is simulated with thousands of Monte Carlo runs on real data and cited sources. Interactive parameters, verifiable results, all in the browser without sending any data. Scenarios on AI and employment, energy consumption, drug discovery, digital euro.

civica.title: Civica
civica.subtitle: Political systems configurator
civica.description: An interactive platform to explore, compare and configure different political systems. Allows you to understand the implications of institutional choices through visualizations and comparative scenarios.

neuralforming.title: Neuralforming
neuralforming.subtitle: Hybrid board game for schools
neuralforming.description: Transform your classroom into a democratic parliament. Neuralforming is a hybrid board game that engages students in an immersive AI governance experience: they propose laws, debate ethical implications and vote on decisions that will shape the future of artificial intelligence. An educational experience that combines play, democracy and technological awareness.

argo.title: Progetto Argo
argo.subtitle: Privacy-first note-taking app
argo.description: A note-taking application based on end-to-end encryption, zero knowledge architecture and privacy by design. Designed to ensure your notes remain private and under your exclusive control, without compromises on security or user experience.

eclipse.title: Eclipse
eclipse.subtitle: Privacy-first menstrual cycle tracking
eclipse.description: An app that restores sovereignty over your body's data. In a landscape where menstrual tracking apps sell intimate information to third parties, Eclipse puts privacy at the center: end-to-end encryption, zero knowledge architecture, and data that stays exclusively on your device. A digital act of resistance for bodily autonomy and reproductive health, because your cycle data is not a commodity to be sold.

cta.title: Want to know why we do this?
cta.description: This academy is born from the principles of our manifesto. Discover the values that guide every Relatronica project.

manifesto.title: The future is not a place we arrive at.
manifesto.opening: It is a place we build. Every day, with every choice, with every tool we design and every question we ask.
manifesto.preamble: We live in an age where the future is narrated by those who have the power to shape it — often behind closed doors, often without consulting those who will bear the consequences. We believe that imagining the future is a political act, and that design is the tool to make it accessible to everyone. We are not prophets. We are designers, researchers and activists who believe in the power of the right questions, open tools and informed communities.

p1.title: The future is a collective project
p1.body: No algorithm, no government, no corporation should have a monopoly on imagination. The future belongs to those who inhabit it. That's why we design tools that enable communities to explore scenarios, compare possibilities and build shared visions. We refuse to accept that the future is a product to be sold.

p2.title: Technology must serve communities, not control them
p2.body: Every technology embodies the values of those who design it. We choose to design for autonomy, not dependency. For transparency, not opacity. For empowerment, not extraction. Civic tech is not an industry — it is a responsibility.

p3.title: Knowledge is power only when it is accessible
p3.body: Data locked in a database does not change the world. Research locked in an academic paper does not inform citizens. We believe in knowledge mapping as a practice of democratisation: making visible what is hidden, connecting what seems isolated, translating complexity into understanding.

p4.title: Design must provoke, not just solve
p4.body: Speculative design does not seek immediate solutions — it seeks the questions we have not yet asked. A good future scenario is not one that predicts correctly, but one that changes how we think about the present. We design to disturb the comfort of inevitability.

p5.title: Transparency is not optional
p5.body: Every tool we build must be understandable, verifiable and contestable. We do not believe in black boxes, unreadable terms of service and automated decisions without explanation. If you cannot understand how it works, you cannot trust it — and you should not have to.

p6.title: Activism is built with tools
p6.body: Words matter, but tools matter more. A well-designed infographic can change a public debate. A data visualisation can unmask an injustice. An open platform can give voice to the voiceless. We don't just denounce — we build the alternatives.

p7.title: Connections matter more than isolated data
p7.body: A climate event, a political decision and a technological innovation may seem unrelated — until you map their relationships. We believe that true understanding arises from connections, not accumulation. That's why we build maps, graphs and visualisations that reveal the hidden fabric of reality.

p8.title: Dissent is design
p8.body: Refusing the future imposed on us is the first act of design. Saying "this is not inevitable" is design. Saying "an alternative exists" is design. Saying "who bears the consequences?" is design. Informed and constructive dissent is the engine of change.

p9.title: We don't design for the future — we design the future
p9.body: The difference is fundamental. Designing "for" the future means adapting to what comes. Designing "the" future means having the courage to imagine what could be and working to make it possible. This is our commitment. This is Relatronica.

manifesto.closing: These are not abstract principles. They are the criteria by which we evaluate every project, every tool, every decision. If you share this vision, don't stand by — join us in building futures that are more just, more open and more aware.
manifesto.signature: Relatronica — Born at CERN, inspired by the Web, guided by the future.
